justification: The paper describes using the BART to assess risk-taking behavior, specifically noting that they calculated the adjusted mean pumps (i.e., the average number of pumps for all unexploded balloons) as the primary measure of risk-taking.

The paper uses the GDT to evaluate risk-taking by calculating a net score where risky choices are subtracted from safer choices, providing another measure of risk-taking that is compared with the BART results.
